definition: to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots

sentences.english: Taxes, book-keeping and other accounting related stuff should be treated by an expert.
sentences.chinese: 税收，簿记和其他会计相关的东西应被视为一个专家。

sentences.english: City and Guilds 709, Hotel Reception and Bookkeeping (1979).
sentences.chinese: 年，英国伦敦城市行业协会，酒店接待和簿记。

sentences.english: She deputed the bookkeeping to me while he was away.
sentences.chinese: 在他外出时他把簿记工作交给了我。

sentences.english: One of Grandma's sisters was a bookkeeper.
sentences.chinese: 奶奶的一个姐姐是簿记员。

sentences.english: Virgo wears a neatly-pressed suit and tells everyone they're a bookkeeper.
sentences.chinese: 处女座穿着熨帖的套装，逢人便说自己是簿记员。

sentences.english: That means being an accountant is much more difficult than being a bookkeeper.
sentences.chinese: 也就是说，当会计师比当簿记员难得多。

sentences.english: The bookkeepers work is recording financial data.
sentences.chinese: 簿记员的工作是记录财务数据。

sentences.english: The principle of duality is the basis of the double-entry bookkeeping system on which accounting is based.
sentences.chinese: 二重性是复式簿记系统为基础的会计基本原则。

sentences.english: A good one will save you all sorts of headaches.
sentences.chinese: 一个好的簿记员能免除你各种烦恼。

sentences.english: It requires some kind of bookkeeping to keep records about transactions.
sentences.chinese: 它要求某些种类的簿记保存有关交易的记录。

sentences.english: This means that there will always be the need for financial book-keeping.
sentences.chinese: 这表示财务方面的簿记工作是一定少不了的。

sentences.english: Eric earned his bread and butter as a bookkeeper, but added a little jam by working with a dance band on weekends.
sentences.chinese: 簿记员来维持生计，且利用周末当舞会伴奏赚些外快。

sentences.english: Under the double-entry bookkeeping system, the twofold effect of every transaction is recorded.
sentences.chinese: 在复式簿记系统下，要记录各笔交易的双重影响。

sentences.english: Persons with little knowledge of accounting may fail to understand the difference between accounting and bookkeeping.
sentences.chinese: 缺乏会计知识的人常不理解会计与簿记的区别。

sentences.english: A(small) business may employ only one bookkeeper.
sentences.chinese: 小企业只雇用一个簿记员。

definition: remittance/funds paid to a bank account
to underwrite (i.e. guarantee financing)/underwriting/to sell as agent/consignee
Central Bank of the Republic of China (Taiwan)
